div.p: Greetings. Although I do not have, indeed at present, most illustrious man and most revered father in Christ, anything of particular importance to write about, yet in order to show my affection and reverence towards you, I did not wish to delay writing any longer. Concerning matters neither French nor Belgian nor even those of Wittenberg, we have nothing certain at this time, except that the Spaniard is said to be recruiting new legions.
What the Rhaetians are doing, we will soon learn from the envoy of our city when he returns.

In recent days, I received a Latin response to the speech of Belleverius delivered at the Swiss Diet and printed in German, in which response, as I earnestly wished, whatever that slanderer and reviler devised is gravely and solidly refuted. The writer calls himself Wolfgang Brisbach...
